decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Endbringer while using mana acceleration from lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors. The inclusion of cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Walking Ballista provide additional versatility and removal options. Additionally, the deck has some land destruction elements with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist backed up by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The key strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with fast threats. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game, utilizing counterspells and removal to protect its creatures and maintain constant pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells and maximize flexibility in casting them.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Glimmerposts, along with various mana producing artifacts, in order to cheat out big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes powerful colorless spells like All Is Dust and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional utility and threat options, while cards like Trinisphere and Sorcerous Spyglass help control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their own strategy efficiently.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly getting threats on the board while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Gurmag Angler provide the majority of the deck's threats, backed up by efficient instant and sorcery spells like Lightning Bolt and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the game, utilizing cards like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's plays. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. The key idea is to maintain control of the board through counter spells like Daze and Force of Will, while also deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to pressure the opponent. The deck's versatility comes from its ability to switch between controlling the game with counterspells or burning the opponent down with direct damage spells. Furthermore, the inclusion of cards like True-Name Nemesis and Brazen Borrower provide additional threats and disruption to outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach along with various spells and artifacts to generate infinite loops or large amounts of mana to win the game quickly. By using cards like Brainstorm, Enlightened Tutor, and Lion's Eye Diamond, the player can set up their combo pieces efficiently and protect their strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Pact of Negation. The deck's win condition can vary between using Grapeshot, Brain Freeze, or Grinding Station to deal massive amounts of damage or mill the opponent's deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Cloudpost lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. By using cards like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo to accelerate mana production and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents, the deck aims to bring out massive threats like Ulamog and Karn, the Great Creator to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Ugin, the Ineffable and All Is Dust provides additional removal options, while cards like Manifold Key and Sorcerous Spyglass offer utility and disruption. With a mix of ramp and control elements, this combo deck works to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing lands as both resources and disruption tools. By maximizing the synergy between lands like Dark Depths, Thespian's Stage, and Field of the Dead, the deck can generate powerful threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Abrupt Decay further adds to the control aspect of the deck, allowing for flexibility in handling different types of threats.

The main focus of this Infect combo deck is to quickly pump up and protect small creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf with spells like Invigorate, Berserk, and Vines of Vastwood to deal lethal poison damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and prevent the opponent from stopping the Infect creatures. The mana base consists of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells on curve and quickly assemble the combo.

This deck focuses on using the powerful combo of Underworld Breach, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Brain Freeze to mill out the opponent's library and win the game using Thassa's Oracle. By controlling the opponent's spells with counterspells and disruption like Teferi, Time Raveler and Orim's Chant, while digging for combo pieces with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, the deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and efficiently. With a mix of protection, disruption, and combo pieces, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a game-winning combo.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost lands and artifacts like Grim Monolith to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also has a utility land package with cards like Karakas and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to provide additional support. In addition, the deck includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down opponents and pave the way for its combo finish.

The deck focuses on using powerful control cards and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cantrips and efficient removal spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for playing a variety of colors, enabling flexibility in answers to different threats. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Chandra and Jace, along with versatile cards like Oko and Snapcaster Mage, gives the deck multiple angles of attack and ways to close out games efficiently. The deck prioritizes resource management and careful decision-making to outmaneuver opponents and ultimately control the game.

The deck focuses on using "Show and Tell" to cheat powerful high-cost creatures like Emrakul or Griselbrand onto the battlefield early. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. Cunning Wish allows for additional flexibility in finding key cards from the sideboard, such as Veil of Summer for protection against disruption. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces, putting immense pressure on the opponent and potentially winning the game in just a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play powerful artifacts such as Chalice of the Void, Ensnaring Bridge, and Karn, the Great Creator, while disrupting opponents with cards like Force of Will and Narset, Parter of Veils. This Aggro - Artifacts Blue deck utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal to ramp up and generate mana efficiently. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza, Lord High Artificer provide additional value and synergize well with the artifact-heavy strategy. The deck aims to control the board and win through artifact synergy and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Oko, as well as versatile creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl. It also utilizes counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Card draw and manipulation are key with Brainstorm and Ponder, while board control is maintained with Terminus and Swords to Plowshares. Mana fixing is provided by Arcum's Astrolabe, and the deck has the ability to generate late-game threats with Entreat the Angels and Uro. Mystic Sanctuary helps recur important spells, while the land base is optimized for consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the card Underworld Breach to create a powerful combo that revolves around casting spells from the graveyard, particularly Brain Freeze and Thassa's Oracle. It also includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and execute a game-winning sequence that allows the player to deck their opponent or achieve a win with Thassa's Oracle's ability. The deck includes various cantrips, counterspells, and tutor effects to help find and protect the combo pieces.
